page.title: 09LOCAL PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: Our area is called Mourne which comes from the Irish MOO RIN meaning a mountain ridge. A corner called Sawhill also comes from the Irish Sawell meaning barn. Two roads of interest are Majors Hill named after a man nicknamed the Major and the Grove Road, so called because it leads to a grove of trees. The main historical feature in our area is the cornmill which dates backs to 1830.It houses a graindrying kiln,three sets of mill stones and ancillary machinery.It is powered by a water wheel which has now been restored to fully working order. The harbour of Annalong is situated on the ford of the river.It was built in 1758. Since then many boats have been tied up in it. The meaning of the word 'Annalong' is ford of ships, because of the Vikings.
